entry.title: Testimonials
entry.summary: Testimonials My son really enjoys learning and playing games with his mentor. Alexa has gone above and beyond anything I expected. We are so grateful for her. She is an amazing role model and I would consider her part of our family now, she is…
entry.content:
Testimonials

My son really enjoys learning and playing games with his mentor.

Alexa has gone above and beyond anything I expected. We are so grateful for her. She is an amazing role model and I would consider her part of our family now, she is an awesome “big sis!” ...We want to support Alexa the way she has been there for us and often included my oldest child as well, which is above and beyond!

The girls both play games with their mentors. They have interesting conversations and chat about things going on in the world.

entry.title: How It Works
entry.summary: How It Works: Finding a Mentor How It Works: Becoming a MentorYou fill out a Google form. We'll get some basic information about you, your interests, and your experience.You have a short, virtual interview where we ask you a few questions about your experience and…
entry.content:
How It Works: Finding a Mentor

  1. You fill out a Google form with your child (they can fill it out themselves if they are over 13!). We'll get some basic information about you, your child, and what you are looking for.
  2. We pair your child with a mentor based on their availability, preferences, and interests. You'll receive an email connecting you with a mentor!
  3. You, your child, and your mentor have a Family Meeting virtually or in person. Together you decide on a meeting schedule and figure out your goals.
  4. Your child meets regularly with their mentor and forms a bond with them!

How It Works: Becoming a Mentor

  1. You fill out a Google form. We'll get some basic information about you, your interests, and your experience.
  2. You have a short, virtual interview where we ask you a few questions about your experience and interests and tell you more about the program.
  3. We pair you with a mentee based on your availability, preferences, and interests. You'll receive an email connecting you with a mentee!
  4. You, your mentee, and your mentee's parent or guardian have a Family Meeting virtually or in person. Together you decide on a meeting schedule and figure out your goals. 
  5. You meet regularly with your mentee and form a bond with them!
  6. You attend virtual weekly Mentor Meet-Ups to meet and learn from other mentors and receive support.

entry.title: Team
entry.summary: Team Madeline Liberman founded Reading Kids Connect in May of 2020. As Director, she is responsible for intake and support of mentors and mentees, administration, and development. Madeline is also a mentor with the virtual mentorship program Hearts Over Hands. In high school, she was…
entry.content:
Team

Madeline Liberman

Founder and Director

Madeline Liberman founded Reading Kids Connect in May of 2020. As Director, she is responsible for intake and support of mentors and mentees, administration, and development. Madeline is also a mentor with the virtual mentorship program Hearts Over Hands. In high school, she was a co-leader of the BOLD club, a leadership and empowerment club for middle school girls in Reading. A 2019 graduate from Reading Memorial High School, Madeline is pursuing a B.A. in Urban Studies from Barnard College.

AUTUMN HENDRICKSON

Assistant Director

Autumn Hendrickson joined the team in early June and has been working with Madeline Liberman ever since. As an assistant director, Autumn does a little bit of a lot of things, from helping to take notes during meetings, to writing emails and occasionally posting for social media, and contributing to the Reading Kids Connect newsletter. She will be attending Endicott College majoring in English Secondary Education.

entry.title: Mission
entry.summary: Mission A mentor is someone who allows you to see the hope inside yourself. - Oprah Winfrey Mission Statement We are a group of Reading residents participating in a mentorship program to better ourselves and our community. Originally, we started this to provide a way…
entry.content:
Mission

A mentor is someone who allows you to see the hope inside yourself.

- Oprah Winfrey

Mission Statement

We are a group of Reading residents participating in a mentorship program to better ourselves and our community. Originally, we started this to provide a way to ease the pain of social isolation created by quarantining during the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic but we are adapting and changing to ensure that this mentorship program is available to all those who need and want it.

Our Objectives

  • Build strong and positive connections between older students and younger students.
  • Give young adults a way to take on additional responsibilities while bettering their community.
  • Create a safe place for learning, whether it's academic learning or emotional and mental growth.
